intro: Epigynum forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' epigynum, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
